Case reference: 2014006380.CaseDesc: Dean Kelly Morrison was last seen October 23, 2013, after being dismissed from his job. His vehicle was left abandoned on a ranch.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Van had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2021022554.CaseDesc: Muoi Nguyen was last seen on January 5, 1990 and was reported missing on January 12, 1990. Police have not been able to locate Muoi NGUYEN.

Case reference: 2006018099.CaseDesc: On January 4, 1994, David Ernest Rowbotham was last seen in the Belleville/Trenton Ontario area.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen in the Cataract Creek area where his abandoned vehicle with all his belongings was located by agents of Fish and Wildlife.

Case reference: 2014006315.CaseDesc: Julia STROBACH was last seen in her residence on Braidwood Road in Courtenay, British Columbia on October 31st, 2013 in the early evening hours.  Unfortunately, after a lengthy and comprehensive investigation police have been unable to find any trace of Julia.  Police along with Julia’s friends and family are gravely concerned for Julia's wellbeing as she has been out of contact for a year now.  It is completely out of character for Julia to be out of contact with her friends and family for so long, especially with her 3 year old son.  Police are appealing to anyone with information about Julia's movements and activities in the days and weeks leading up to October 31st, 2013, to get in touch with investigators immediately.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Long,  Often dyed red

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2020009588.CaseDesc: On February 8, 1989, at approximately 7:30am, Soekarmia Sarbirja was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Soekarmia was to attend an immigration hearing on February 10, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2016065657.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1982, this male was recovered from Lake Erie near Port Colborne. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160-170 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is not known how long he had been in the water.

Teeth: Missing third molars; he has some silver fillings and 2 crowns
Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, t-shirt; inscription on the front of the shirt read "SAVE ELECTRICITY..DO IT IN THE DARK"
Socks: Tan, White, rust colored trim on the cuff
Boots: Tan, wearing a single work boot, approximately size 10

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2008007599.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1978, Hugh Bain and three others were participating in the Oshawa Clipper Race from Oshawa, Ontario to Olcott, New York and back to Oshawa. Mr. Bain took his turn to operate the 24 foot boat. A large wave hit the boat and broke over it. The movement of the boat and the wave breaking over the boat sent him over the port side into Lake Ontario.  Mr. Bain has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004091.CaseDesc: Mark Gibbons was seen for the last time on February 1, 1991 at his home in Calgary, Alberta.  He was reported missing by his family and Mark has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001801.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1992, Marshall Holmes wandered into the bush near Vassar, Manitoba and has not been seen since. Mr. Holmes was 73 years old at the time and was described as a recluse and a hermit. Mr. Holmes had gone missing in the past and had returned on his own accord. He enjoyed being in the bush and liked to sleep in the long grass. The last time he went missing he was gone for 3 days and came out of the bush when he became hungry. Extensive searches were done by land, air and with the assistance of a police dog. Marshall Holmes has never been located.

Jacket: Nylon, Blue, White, Has 3 vertical stripes

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Hair: Black, White, Straight, Short, Grey/black, messy; Beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, Irregular, broken/missing lower and upper  - decayed

Case reference: 2019073876.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2019, Anton Katona was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020127.CaseDesc: Jocelyne Dubé, 57, was last seen on October 2nd 2008. On the night of her disappearance, she received a phone call from a friend and a visit from her daughter at her Piedmont, Quebec residence.  A few days after the disappearance, her abandoned vehicle was found in Montreal, Quebec. Everything indicates that the car had been there for a few days.

Case reference: 2014004010.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1993, Howard Metacat was last seen in Indian Cabins, Alberta. Howard was hunting alone along the Hay River, 6 miles north of Indian Cabins and wandered away from his campsite in the early morning hours of September 17, 1993.

Scar: Neck, 2 inches on the right side

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2006025099.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1988, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 40-74, was recovered from the Otonabee River, south of Lock 19 in Peterborough. There were stains on his teeth, which suggests that he was a smoker. The remains could have been in the water for a few weeks to many years.

Teeth: Stained, Although he was missing most of his molars, his upper left third molar was carious and could have caused him significant pain.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2021014303.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2013, at approximately 3:56 p.m., Peter Lipinoga was last seen in the area of Terrapin Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Peter was despondent.

Case reference: 2018046052.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1997, Eric Wong was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Eric was in Canada continuing his education and had contacted his mother in October 1997 for help with his tuition fees.

Case reference: 2019040192.CaseDesc: The skull belonging to an adult male was found on a beach near Ucluelet, British Columbia in October 1980. The man had a strong jawline and had a visible gap in his teeth on the upper left side. It is believed he was deceased several years prior to skull being recovered.

Case reference: 2006023199.CaseDesc: Kenneth Churney was last seen in March of 1997. He was on a snowmobile travelling northbound toward the trail system head at the rear of Pine Crescent. He never returned from snowmobiling and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Deformity: Left Ring Finger, 0.5 of an inch shorter

Case reference: 2014005111.CaseDesc: Chad Eirikson was reported missing by his mother. He left Vancouver, Canada to tour Central America in December, 1999.  In January, 2000, he called home requesting money a few times and received wire transfers from his mother to continue his trip. He has not been heard from since January 9, 2000.

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, A penny with the initials "T.W."
Left Upper Arm, Bear on a rock

Case reference: 2016045557.CaseDesc: In January 2015, Warner Huckerby was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020008538.CaseDesc: In mid-June 1976, Peter Vollar was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Peter had advised he was heading to London, Ontario for two weeks to seek job opportunities. All of his personal belongings were left behind.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton. Early the following morning, Amber made a post on social media, which she constantly used to communicate with family and friends. Her social media account had no further activity after this time. It is unknown when she left her residence, what she was last wearing or how she may have left. Amber did not have access to a vehicle and would typically use public transit to get around. She lived a high risk lifestyle and seemed despondent on the night she was last seen.

Case reference: 2014003731.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1964 at 1:00 p.m. Murray Hansen left Berens River, Manitoba to go to Black River to deliver some items to a family member. At approximately 3:00 p.m. that day it started to storm and the water on the lake became rough. Mr. Hansen planned to stay in Black River overnight and then return to Berens River. When 5 days passed and he hadn't returned home, his wife began to look for him and discovered that he had never arrived in Black River. On November 3, 1964, Mr. Hansen's boat was found turned over near Bigstone Point and was approximately 100 yards from the shore. Searches were done by air, land and boat but the body of Mr. Hansen was never recovered. Murray Hansen is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2005001499.CaseDesc: Lois was last seen shortly before midnight at the Village of Lucknow reunion dance on July 3, 1988. She left there and returned to her residence in Kincardine, Ontario where she resided alone. The police investigation indicates Lois was going through her usual evening routine before retiring. Lois, described as a devoted family person and a dedicated worker, failed to report for work on July 4, 1988. Her friends and family became concerned and notified police that she was missing.

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2019040199.CaseDesc: In March 1966, the remains of a male believed to be between the ages of 50-60 were discovered by the CN Railway tracks in Chilliwack, British Columbia. The unidentified male had lost many of his teeth during life and had prominent eyebrows and a broken nose which was crooked to the right. It is believed he may have fallen or have been pushed from a moving train.

Teeth: Most of the teeth have been lost
Shoes: Black, Rubber soles, "Bilt-Rite Oil Proof", size 10, width E
Pants: Blue, With brown and white suspenders
Coat: Wool, Brown, Herringbone pattern, striped brown and light brown
Deformity: Nose, Nose crooked to the right due to an old injury

Case reference: 2014003152.CaseDesc: Sylvain Baril was last seen on August 8, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2014004252.CaseDesc: Gordie Dixon was reported missing by family members.  Mr. Dixon may have been seen on the Macleod Trail in Calgary, Alberta a couple of months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001197.CaseDesc: On March 30, 2004, a motorist travelling on Hwy 21 at Content Bridge noticed human remains in the Red Deer River. Stettler RCMP were contacted and the remains were brought to shore a short time later. The body was badly decomposed but had some clothing attached and there appeared to be a tattoo on the body’s right arm.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was last seen between late June and August 1990 in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, and was reported missing in September 1990. At the time of her disappearance, Mary Rose was residing at the Gold Range Hotel. In 2003, partial human remains were discovered in Yellowknife, and forensic DNA analysis determined that the remains were those of Mary Rose Keadjuk in 2018. The investigation into her disappearance  is still active and ongoing.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2012020083.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, John Roy MacLellan, 79 years old, was last seen in Lintlaw, SK. Mr. MacLellan's medical condition made him, at times, confused. In October of 1980, his vehicle was located in the Usherville district. Searches of that area have failed to locate Mr. MacLellan.

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014001090.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1973, the body of a healthy Caucasian adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-49 was discovered in the Pacific Spirit Regional Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had a significant amount of high quality dental work, including several extracted teeth. It is believed he died on or around June 30, 1973 and may have been despondent when he was last seen alive.

Shirt: Cloth, Blue, Mens Store in Toronto brand, button-down
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Timex, Mens Wrist Watch

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003305.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1987, Wade Stanley Saxton was seen for the last time as he left his residence in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021024071.CaseDesc: On April 19, 2021, an unidentified man was discovered in the woods east of Huntsville, Ontario. A vape, cigarette filter and four medical diagnostic tabs were located nearby.

Case reference: 2007003599.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2000 Marilyn Zaitzeff left her cottage located on Lambert Island, Lake Superior. She was operating a personal watercraft at the time. The watercraft was located overturned several hundred metres away from the cottage. Mrs. Zaitzeff has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020161.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River in Vancouver. He was warmly dressed in two layers of clothing and work boots.

Sweater: Green, Blue, Striped, red on the cuffs
Black, "Haines her way" brand, size small

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2014003143.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1978, Diane Jaspersen, native of Calgary, Alberta, was last seen in Hope, British-Columbia. She was hitch hiking with her dog "Jack" on the highway leading towards Vancouver Island. Diane was headed to a friend's  cabin  where she was supposed to be staying and attend a festival, but never made it.

Case reference: 2012020097.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1986, Corrine Moosomin, 25 years old, was last seen at approximately 4:00 a.m. on the Saulteaux First Nation near North Battleford, SK. She was last seen walking on a grid road. Corrine was reported missing and extensive searches failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014005899.CaseDesc: Karen Gilbert left her home in Quebec City on October 7, 2012, at some point during the night. She was subsequently dropped off by taxi in the vicinity of the Montmorency Falls. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2012020122.CaseDesc: Robert Bishara was last seen during the evening of March 17th, 2009 in Brossard, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, he was driving a black 2006 Chevrolet Trailblazer 2006 bearing Quebec licence plate 941TBA. The car has not been located. Robert originates from Egypt and no one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006000799.CaseDesc: This adult male was seen walking on the ice on Lake Ontario. His body was later recovered from Lake Ontario, near Queens Quay.

Hair: Black, Short, Facial Stubble, Dark Eyebrows
Shirt: White, Black, T-shirt, 3/4 length, size Large, black sleeves
Blue, Grey, Plaid, Long sleeve with sleeves rolled up
Watch: Black, Bulova Set-O-Matic, Black nylon band
Jacket: Blue, Grey, Waist length, zippered vinyl hood, size Medium
Jeans: Blue, 30 inch waist, legs have been shortened

Case reference: 2014006374.CaseDesc: Rosalie Jean ALLAN was last seen at the end of November, start of December 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020008397.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1981, Brian Orr was last seen by his parents in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Brian’s parents believe that he was in financial troubles.

Scar: Lower Left Back, 3 inches in length and half an inch wide
Right Eye, From nose to cheek bone on right eyelid

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2016061833.CaseDesc: On 11 April, 1982, a female was found floating in the Inner Harbour near the Royal Canadian Yacht Club. Her appendix was present. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 136 lbs and her length was measured at 5'1", however, these measurements may not represent her actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is estimated to have been in water from several weeks to months.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Shoulder, healed fracture of her clavicle
Scar: Right Abdomen, her gallbladder had been removed

Case reference: 2014001607.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1979, Joseph Cohen was seen for the last time in Montreal. It was a Saturday night, he was out with friends at the Blanche Neige restaurant located in Côte-des-Neiges. His vehicle was located in a parking lot facing Valois Road.

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014001233.CaseDesc: On September 15, 2013, the remains of an Asian or mixed race male were discovered in Kananaskis County near Highway 40. The individual may have had episodes of malnutrition or anemia.

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2005005699.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1991, the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Niagara River between Horseshoe Falls and the "Maid of the Mist" boat docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 113 lbs, however this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had signs of having suffered an acute or chronic right lung infection. He is estimated to have been dead for several months. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is either of European ancestry, or South Asian ancestry, or mixed European and South Asian ancestry.

Teeth: Several amalgam fillings in his teeth and multiple posterior teeth in his upper and lower jaw were lost/removed prior to death.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006270.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Daniel Pierre was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was driving a rented 2014 black Jeep Grand Cherokee, and was accompanied by his reddish brown, with a white chest, male pit-bull. The vehicle was subsequently located on the corner of Deguire Boulevard and Ashton Street in the Ville Saint-Laurent neighbourhood in Montreal. Daniel is a diabetic and depends on medication that is not in his possession.

Case reference: 2005002299.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1983, this male was recovered from Lake Erie off the shore of Holiday Beach, Malden Township. His weight at autopsy was estimated to be between 170-180 lbs., however, due to the incompleteness of the remains, the weight range suggested is an underestimate. This individual died as a result of foul play. It is believed that he had been in the water for approximately 6 months prior to recovery.

Hair: Brown, Red, Dyed, dyed reddish hairs interspersed with dark brown hairs and some greying hairs
Jeans: Denim, Blue, remnants of blue denim including a button with the inscription "Corniche Jeans"; size 31
Underwear: Light Blue, remnants of a blue elastic waistband which may be boxer shorts or swimming trunks

Case reference: 2016065831.CaseDesc: On October 12, 1977, the remains of a male, believed to be an adult, were found in the water off of Coney Island, Lake of the Woods, Kenora. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was fully clothed, however, no description of clothing is available.  It is believed that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Case reference: 2012020171.CaseDesc: An adult male was found in a forested area of the Scuzzy Log Dump near North Bend. This is on the west side of the Fraser River, across from Boston Bar.

Teeth: Good dental care with some fillings

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2014006505.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2014, Sandra Mensah was seen for the last time in the Cartierville district of Montreal, Quebec. Her boyfriend came to pick her up at her home during the evening. Sandra has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020648.CaseDesc: Andrew Wiebe went missing from his residence in Saskatoon, SK on January 11, 1988. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was later located abandoned in the Anglin Lake District, SK.

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey left the Abbey Lane Hospital on January 28, 2006, and hasn't been seen since.  Marilyn is bi-polar and had to take medication for numerous ailments; she did not have her medication with her.

Case reference: 2015015739.CaseDesc: On October 5, 2014, at approximately 12:40 pm, the body of a black woman was seen floating near the bank of the Rivière des Prairies in the Saint-François district of Laval. She had no identification.

Tattoo: Left Wrist, African symbol-Adinkra-Hye won hye

Case reference: 2014002734.CaseDesc:
Martin Munawych was last seen the day he left a relatives residence near Lac La Biche, AB, he appeared to be happy at the time. 
It is believed that may have been travelling to Edmonton or Calgary. He has not been seen since.
